channel.title: Authors | Loïc N. Michel
channel.copyright: Site content: Loïc Michel · Photographs: Loïc Michel, Phil Jane & [Arnaud Abadie](https://seaescape.fr/)

item.description: Collaboration topics: scientific diving, underwater photography, seagrass ecology. I was Arnaud’s master thesis advisor.

I’m a marine ecologist broadly interested in how food web structure and trophic interactions influence ecosystem functioning and biodiversity. I’m also interested in how natural or anthropogenic environmental variations impact animal feeding, and how ecological plasticity mediates marine consumers’ response to change. I mostly tackle those issues by using polar and deep-sea benthic invertebrates as ecological models, and by developing approaches based on trophic markers, notably stable isotopes.
Collaboration topics: hydrothermal vent ecology, community ecology.
Collaboration topics: shark ecophysiology and trophic ecology.
Collaboration topics: ecology of Mediterranean neuston & plankton
Collaboration topics: fatty acid trophic markers.
Collaboration topics: marine mammal trophic ecology and ecotoxicology.
Collaboration topics: Southern ocean ecology, climate change, biodiversity informatics, starfish ecology.

Collaboration topics: stable isotope ecology, seagrass ecology, Southern Ocean ecology, amphipod ecology & diversity. Patrick was my PhD advisor.

Collaboration topics: Southern ocean ecology, sea urchin ecology and physiology. Chantal is now happily retired.
